org.latency4j

Interface Latency4JConstants


  • public interface Latency4JConstants

    Latency4J library constants.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CONFIG_FILE_VM_PROP
      The name of the system property which can be used to specify the path to the epsilon configuration file.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_CONFIGURATION_RESOURCE_NAME
      The assumed name of the epsilon configuration file.
      static java.lang.String JAVA_TMP_FILE_FOLDER
      The name of the standard Java system property which holds the path to the system temporary folder i. e.  "java.io.tmpdir".
      static java.lang.String LATENCY4J_LOGGER_NAME
      The category utilised for logging alerts where none is specified in the MissedTargetAlertLogger configuration.

    • Field Detail

      • LATENCY4J_LOGGER_NAME

        static final java.lang.String LATENCY4J_LOGGER_NAME

        The category utilised for logging alerts where none is specified in the MissedTargetAlertLogger configuration. The value of this constant is "LATENCY4J".

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_FILE_VM_PROP

        static final java.lang.String CONFIG_FILE_VM_PROP

        The name of the system property which can be used to specify the path to the epsilon configuration file. The value of this constant is "latency4j.config".

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CONFIGURATION_RESOURCE_NAME

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_CONFIGURATION_RESOURCE_NAME

        The assumed name of the epsilon configuration file. This is the value used if the property CONFIG_FILE_VM_PROP is not specified. The value of this constant is "CLASSPATH:/latency4j.xml".

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JAVA_TMP_FILE_FOLDER

        static final java.lang.String JAVA_TMP_FILE_FOLDER

        The name of the standard Java system property which holds the path to the system temporary folder i. e.  "java.io.tmpdir".

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
